intro: Falconera spiralis, commonly known as the spiral helix, is a unique flowering plant characterized by its spiral-shaped inflorescence. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is native to the temperate regions of the southern hemisphere. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a whorled pattern around the stem. Falconera spiralis thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
